Key Match Events: Luis Severino pitched seven crisp innings, allowing only one earned run and striking out five.
Francisco Lindor sparked New York’s lineup again with a key performance.
Marte grounded into a double play, allowing Iglesias to score.
Duran singled to right, scoring Rafaela.
Nimmo doubled to center, scoring Lindor.
Torrens doubled to left, and Stewart scored on a fielding error by left fielder O'Neill.
Lindor singled to right, scoring Torrens.
Post-Match Reflections: The surging Mets crept closer to playoff position by beating the Boston Red Sox 4-1.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was held at Citi Field with an attendance of 35,064.
The game lasted 2 hours and 22 minutes.
